p: The PCA analysis of the terpenoid composition from L. origanoides L. origanoides × velutina, L. velutina, L. sidoides, L. salviifolia and L. grata showed no specific grouping by species (Fig. 5), suggesting that they are different chemotypes. Conversely, Sandasi et al. [ 51], when investigating the chemotaxonomic differentiation of South-African Lippia species, namely L. javanica, L. scaberrima, L. rehmannii and L. wilmsii, were able to separate the species into distinct clusters. These results, paired with AFPL and ITS, suggest that L. origanoides, L. origanoides × velutina, L. velutina, L. sidoides, L. salviifolia, and L. grata belong to the same species, but present different chemotypes, for more detail see Additional file 4.
